The film "The Pursuit of Happyness" is based on the remarkable true story of Chris Gardner, a homeless single father who became a successful stockbroker.

Gardner had been struggling to make ends meet and support his son Christopher when he decides to pursue an unpaid internship at Dean Witter Reynolds as a stockbroker. Despite facing numerous obstacles such as losing their apartment, staying in shelters or public restrooms, Chris remains committed to completing the program.

Throughout the movie, Gardner's dedication and strong work ethic eventually pay off. In real life too, his career started with success; he went on to buy stakes in lucrative businesses like Bear Stearns & Co., leading him to establish his own multimillion-dollar investment firm called Gardner Rich & Co. in 1987.

Chris sold parts of this brokerage firm for millions which led him towards other ventures that involved philanthropy efforts and motivational speaking engagements. Today Chris advises people around the world about personal choices exploring lessons from history through affordable education initiatives especially ensuring girls' access globally.

In addition to running his business empire and charitable work worldwide, Chris has also published books including "The Pursuit of Happyness," which documents his journey into becoming financially independent despite all odds against him.
